summary: David W. Belin was involved in investigations related to the CIA and the JFK assassination. He is documented conducting an interview with William K. Harvey concerning Harvey's knowledge of assassination plots within the CIA. Belin also received materials related to Allen Dulles and the Warren Commission from E.H. Knoche, including communications between Dulles, Lee Rankin, and J. Edgar Hoover regarding the investigation. His involvement appears to be centered around gathering information and conducting interviews related to the CIA's activities and the Warren Commission's findings.
significance: David W. Belin's significance in the JFK context lies in his role in investigating the CIA's potential involvement in assassination plots and his access to materials related to the Warren Commission. He appears to have been tasked with gathering information and conducting interviews to shed light on these sensitive matters.
